lenders.name: paul van beers
lenders.loan_because:
I think that micro-credits are the best way to help people to develop a small bussiness and to be self-supporting. This will contribute to a more stable and happy society.

Through Kiva we want to sponsor communities and individuals who want to start a small activity by selling water from a handpump in Africa. The small bussiness will create enough money for a salary and to maintain the handpump.

There are many broken down and abandoned handpumps in Africa. With our loan, a Community or person can replace such an old handpump with a new and sustainable Afripump handpump. 

By asking some money for the water service, they can raise some money to maintain the handpump and make this a sustainable service for the community. At the same time, the income can pay back this loan and provide a small salary for a caretaker, who supervises the water fetching. 

It is our experience, that when people have a small financial profit from a water point, they will be more motivated to keep it working. Therefore, we believe tha this idea will contribute to make rural water supply in Africa more sustainable, what will contribute to the millennium goals for water & sanitation.

For this activity, we are looking for reliable local partners that can help to make this idea a reality.

For more info on our activities on this, visit our website www.handpump.org
lenders.occupational_info:
I am the director of WatSan Consult, an independent Dutch organization that advises on how to achieve sustainable rural WatSan (Water & Sanitation) projects in rural developing countries.

We especially focus on water supply with handpumps (promoting the Afripump, a spare part free handpump) and low-cost household water filters (the Kisii filter).

We also maintain an internet water portal to provide WatSan information through the internet.

See also the page of Kiva on our water portal www.watsan.org

lenders.name: Troy
lenders.loan_because: Once upon a time there was a wise man who used to go to the ocean to do his writing. He had a habit of walking on the beach before he began his work. One day he was walking along the shore. As he looked down the beach, he saw a human figure moving like a dancer. He smiled to himself to think of someone who would dance to the day. So he began to walk faster to catch up. As he got closer, he saw that it was a young man and the young man wasn't dancing, but instead he was reaching down to the shore, picking up something and very gently throwing it into the ocean. As he got closer he called out,"Good morning! What are you doing?" The young man paused, looked up and replied, "Throwing starfish in the ocean." "I guess I should have asked, why are you throwing starfish in the ocean?" "The sun is up and the tide is going out. And if I don't throw them in they'll die." "But, young man, don't you realize that there are miles and miles of beach and starfish all along it. You can't possibly make a difference!" The young man listened politely. Then bent down, picked up another starfish and threw it into the sea, past the breaking waves and said, "It made a difference for that one."

lenders.occupational_info:
I am a sole proprietor, of Lomi-Batangas outlet in our home for almost 1 year. I am open to teach the "technology" on how to cook this Chinese cuisine.  The Canton noodle is home-made and cannot be bought in the market that is why it is not salty. The sauce is sticky using flour, and it is shining like gold after cooking.
The toppings are bologna, pork liver, pork meat or kikiam.  Soy sauce, garlic-chili sauce and calamansi/lemon are added to improve its taste.  Almost 95% of our customers are coming back to eat and taste again this instant noodle. I hope I can demonstrate how to cook this food to other aspiring Entrepreneurs to help them introduce new product in their domestic market.
